definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: There should be a very little mic cable slack at the mic stand base.
sentences.chinese: 這將只有麥架基座上的一小部分線的是鬆弛的。

sentences.english: Bob Sugg read only certain bits of the papers he sold.
sentences.chinese: 在鮑勃薩格賣的報紙中，他只看一小部分。

sentences.english: Focus Media would retain a rump ad business.
sentences.chinese: 分衆傳媒將保持一小部分廣告業務。

sentences.english: This is a partial list at best.
sentences.chinese: 這裏列舉的充其量只是一小部分。

sentences.english: She spends only a fraction of her earnings.
sentences.chinese: 她只花了所賺的錢的一小部分。

sentences.english: State-owned companies release only a small fraction of their shares to the market.
sentences.chinese: 國有企業只在市場上投放了一小部分他們的股份。

sentences.english: All of like, only a small part tob love last.
sentences.chinese: 所有的喜歡，最後只有一小部分能夠成爲愛情。

sentences.english: Of course, most signatures will only use a small portion of these methods.
sentences.chinese: 當然，絕大多數簽名僅使用這些方法中的一小部分。

sentences.english: Monosyllabic loanwords constitute only a small proportion of the Chinese loanwords.
sentences.chinese: 漢語藉詞中，單音節外來詞只佔一小部分。

sentences.english: She and a small group of her followers pursued Illidan through the portal.
sentences.chinese: 她和一小部分追隨者追蹤伊利丹越過了傳送門。

sentences.english: But our bodies metabolize only a small fraction of them.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們的身體只能代謝一小部分氣體。

sentences.english: He says that Woolley's study only looked at a small set of tasks.
sentences.chinese: 他說，伍利的研究只看到了任務的一小部分。

sentences.english: It has to do with a small part of our brain called the middle temporal area.
sentences.chinese: 他們研究了我們大腦的一小部分，叫中間暫時區。

sentences.english: The muscle you gain is minuscule compared with the total amount of skeletal muscle in the body.
sentences.chinese: 你獲得的肌肉相對於全身的骨骼肌來說只是一小部分。

sentences.english: When the moon takes a bite-size chunk out of the sun, it's a partial solar eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 如果月球擋住太陽的一小部分，會產生日偏食。

sentences.english: And so, there is a little bit of deflection because plus repels plus.
sentences.chinese: 並且有一小部分的偏轉，是由於正電荷排斥正電荷。

definition: in large part/the greater part/the majority
for the most part/many/most/the greater part/mostly
